alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 9:14AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact Carroll County through 1000 AM CDT... At 913 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Andover, or 8 miles north of Clinton, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Savanna around 920 AM CDT. Argo Fay around 925 AM CDT. Mount Carroll and Chadwick around 930 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lanark and Shannon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
